quoteFirst: No further delay could be admitted, however, if our advance was to be on the same day as that of the {179} French.  The infantry, chafing with impatience, were swarming in the fire trenches.  At
quoteLast: the gas-cylinders were turned on.  At 6.30 A.M. the guns ceased fire, and the ardent soldiers--Regulars, New, and Territorials--dashed forward upon their desperate venture.
title: The British Campaign in France and Flanders, 1915
author: Doyle, Arthur Conan, 1859-1930
